item.title: Urgent Safety Concern – Lack of Lane Markings at Abbey Wood Elevated Roundabout, 16th July
item.description:
I am writing to formally report a serious safety concern regarding the Abbey Wood Elevated Roundabout in Belvedere/Abbey Wood. This roundabout connects major roads including Harrow Manorway, Knee Hill, Abbey Road, Felixstowe Road, and several other important routes. Despite being a large and elevated roundabout with multiple exits, there are no lane markings within the roundabout itself. As a result, drivers are left to navigate without guidance, leading to complete disorder in lane positioning and roundabout discipline. Everyone approaching or using this roundabout follows their own interpretation of where to drive, with no consistency or rule adherence. This creates a chaotic and dangerous environment, especially during busy periods or poor weather conditions when visibility is already compromised. The lack of markings significantly increases the risk of side-swiping, sudden lane changes, and collisions. I strongly believe this roundabout is an accident waiting to happen. Without any form of marking or directional guidance, the current state is highly unsafe for all road users, including learner drivers and those unfamiliar with the area. I urge the Council to prioritise this issue by conducting an inspection of the site and taking immediate steps to: 1. Implement clear and standard-compliant lane markings on all approaches and within the roundabout itself. 2. Install adequate signage to guide drivers on lane selection for different exits. I look forward to your confirmation that this concern has been formally logged and that action will be taken to address it. Thank you for your attention to this pressing safety matter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yesterday I reported to you about :"Vomit that is dried and is in front of 255 Shirland Road., 16th July
item.description:
Yesterday I reported to you about :"Vomit that is dried and is in front of 255 Shirland Road". So far nothing has been done yet!! The whole area needs a through wash down. And I also reported you about :"Wet dog fouling on the pavement which is besides a tree that is on the corner of Shirland Road and Saltram Crescent". The number that is nearest to the fouling is 223 Shirland Road. The fouling is still there and it's been trodden in!! The whole area needs a through wash down. Thank you in anticipation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, Fernhead Road, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hole in pavement, 16th July
item.description:
The ground below the tarmac has been washed away. The void is much bigger than is shown from the surface. The whole of the pavement is unsupported and could collapse. A cone and sandbag have been used to make it safe but I keep having to replace them as they get moved by idiots.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brook Street, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Faded road markings - Chessington Avenue and Ashbourne Avenue, 16th July
item.description:
Dear Bexley Council Team, I am writing to report an urgent issue with faded and almost non-existent road markings at the junction of Chessington Avenue and Ashbourne Avenue in Belvedere, DA17. The give-way lines and any indication of a crossroad are extremely worn out to the point of being invisible. This is a significant safety concern, especially because: • The junction is a crossroad but is not visibly clear to drivers until right at the intersection. • There are no advance warning signs or clear road markings to signal the need to give way. • This junction is also part of a DVSA driving test route from the Erith Test Centre, and multiple candidates (including myself) have encountered safety and assessment challenges here due to the poor condition of the markings. This lack of visibility not only poses a risk of accidents but is also contributing to driving test failures, where candidates are unable to properly assess the junction’s priority without adequate road signage and markings. Requested Action I kindly request that: • The road markings are urgently repainted to clearly denote the junction and give way instructions. • Consideration is given to installing advance warning signage to indicate the presence of the crossroad. Thank you for your attention to this matter, and I look forward to your confirmation that this has been logged for action.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chessington Avenue, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet
